title: Capital's Roman Kemp refuses to deny I'm A Celeb rumours
text:
Speculation has been spreading about Roman potentially appearing on the show (Picture: Getty)

Roman Kemp has refused to deny the rumours that he’s set to take part on this year’s series of I’m A Celebrity.

The Capital Breakfast presenter, who’s currently putting us all to shame as he travels around the country for the No Money Road Trip as he raises money for Global’s Make Some Noise, opened up on the recent rumours.

‘Listen, I get asked to do thousands of shows like that all the time, it’s just about focusing on what I’ve got right now,’ he admitted.

‘[The No Money Road Trip] is the biggest thing for me right now and there’s been such an amazing response, I can’t get over it to be honest.’

When asked if that’s a definite no for shows like I’m A Celeb at the moment, the 26-year-old laughed: ‘You’d have to see, you’d have to see.’

We’ll take that tiny ray of hope.

The star is currently travelling 1000 miles around the UK to present five breakfast shows in five days around the country – plus undertaking challenges which so far have had some pretty nasty consequences.

He’s been busking in Edinburgh (Picture: Global)

Safe to say, we’re not too envious of him right now.

Not mincing his words about just how difficult the challenge is, Roman explained about his 80-mile cycle the previous day: ‘I was just absolutely broken by yesterday. That was the hardest thing I’ve ever done.

‘For keen cyclists, that’s a decent ride but for someone who’s never ridden a bike with gears before, it was just horrendous.’

Roman admitted he was ‘absolutely broken’ after the 80-mile bike ride (Picture: Global)

Meanwhile, Roman admitted he’s had to take some pretty extreme measures to keep his mum from seeing what he’s up to.

Chatting about getting a call from his parents, he said: ‘It was really nice, to be honest everyone else was getting emotional!

‘It’s just nice to hear from them. It’s my dad’s birthday today so I wanted to call him but I couldn’t. So it was nice to hear his voice.

‘They just think I’m an idiot to be honest. They’re like, “Why are you doing this?”. If I had my phone, I’d probably not be doing it because my mum would be going, “Stop, stop, stop”.

The star added: ‘I’ve actually asked the Capital guys if they can block my mum from the account so they don’t see what I’m doing!’

Brutal.
